conclusion: Analyze electric field and potential at center O of equilateral triangle before and after placing charges.
Points A and B have equal magnitude like charges; electric field at O is E; potential at O is not given, potential at infinity is 0.
Electric fields from A and B at O are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction; net electric field at O is E.
Potential at O due to a single charge q at distance r is V = kq/r; total potential at O is sum of potentials from A and B.
An equal magnitude opposite sign charge is placed at C, producing an electric field at O.
Electric field from C is equal in magnitude to E; vector sum of fields from A and B is canceled by field from C; net electric field at O is zero.
Potential at O due to charge at C is negative of potential due to charges at A and B; potential at O is sum of potentials from all three charges.
Electric field strength at O is 0; electric potential at O is negative of initial potential due to charges at A and B.
